translation: All the people offered various kinds of delicious food and drink, and those who ate or licked them [mouthed* bundled] had already prepared their provisions.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，即於其夜，在自室內，作是思惟：『明日集聚摩伽陀國一切人民，
translation: At that time, on that night, the venerable Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa stayed in his own room and thought:

source_sentence: 辦具種種無量飲食，欲來我邊修祭祀法，而此瞿曇大德沙門，脫於是會大眾之前，
translation: They prepared various kinds of food and drink, wishing to come to my side to perform the sacrificial rite. But this holy śramaṇa Gautama renounced his way of life before the assembly.

translation: It shows the superior teaching of supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 若如是者，我之所有利養名聞即當著彼，則於我邊或復減少。
translation: If that's the case, then my profits and fame will be attached to them, and they might decrease again or again at my side.

source_sentence: 唯願方便，此大沙門，明日莫來。』
translation: Please do not come back tomorrow, this great ascetic.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼優婁頻螺迦葉心所念已，過彼夜後，至欝單越，到彼乞食，
translation: At that time the World-honored One, knowing what was in Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa’s mind, after the night had passed, went to Uttarakuru and came there to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 於阿耨達大池邊食食訖，還在彼大池邊，少時靜攝，竟還本林，經行而住。
translation: After he finished his meal at the edge of Anavatapta's large lake, he was stilled at the edge of that large lake for a short time and returned to his native forest, where he walked and stayed.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜已，食後往詣佛世尊所，到佛所已，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān's place after he ate and said to the Buddha, 'Mahāmegha!

source_sentence: 於食至時，辦具亦訖，未審沙門，何故不來？
translation: When the meal arrived, the preparations had also been completed. Why wouldn't the ascetic come if he hadn't yet done so?

source_sentence: 其事雖然，我猶不忘所有諸食上好味者，我今為仁，猶留一分。』
translation: Although this is a good thing, I still won't forget all the delicious flavors of my food, and now that I'm kind, I'll leave a part of it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Sir, my dear friend!

source_sentence: 汝昨夜在靜室之中，獨自而坐，可不如是思惟念言：「我於明朝在所居處，
translation: Good man, this past night you were seated in a quiet room by yourself.

source_sentence: 年常恒作祭祀之法，摩伽陀國所有男女一切人民，將好種種食飲而來，
translation: Every year he always performed rituals, and all the men and women of Magadha came to offer various kinds of food and drink.

source_sentence: 向於我邊。
translation: He's facing me.

source_sentence: 而此大德沙門瞿曇，恐於彼會眾人之前，出現神通，示上人法，則我所有利養名聞，
translation: But this venerable renunciant Gotama is afraid that if he were to manifest his supernatural powers before the assembly of bhikṣus, thereby revealing the dharmas of superior beings, I might gain material benefits and renowned reputation.

source_sentence: 悉著於彼大沙門邊，我則減少，心私願我明日莫來。」
translation: They'll all be at the side of that great ascetic, and I'll diminish, wishing privately for me not to come tomorrow.

source_sentence: 仁者迦葉！
translation: My dear friend Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我於爾時，知仁此心如是想念，過於彼夜，我即騰空，至欝單越，向彼乞食，
translation: Knowing that you had thoughts like this in your mind, I rose into the sky and went to Uttarakuru to beg for food.

source_sentence: 得已來到阿耨達池，如法而食，隨日多少，在彼經行，還向此林宿止而來。』
translation: After he had obtained it, he came to Anavatapta's pond and ate according to the rules, walked there for days and nights, and returned to this forest to stay overnight and come back.'

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa had this thought, 'This great ascetic!

translation: Great is the supernatural power!

source_sentence: 大有威權！

translation: Although it's a transformation, they still won't attain the fruit of arhatship like I am now (Nisa塞 said).'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，居處年常有一大會，名翼宿日。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa always had a large assembly called the wing constellation day when he lived there.

source_sentence: 彼會之日，摩伽陀國數千萬人各來聚集，然其彼會亦有市易，隨諸人輩所須貨買。
translation: On the day of the assembly, several tens of millions of people in Magadha gathered together to buy and sell whatever they needed.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『明朝此處，若沙門來，所有人民皆觀看彼，
translation: At that time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had this thought:

source_sentence: 不為我等造作齋食。』
translation: They won't make a meal for us.'

source_sentence: 彼作如是思惟念已，往詣佛所，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After he had this thought, he went to the Buddha and said to him, 'O great virtuous monk!

source_sentence: 明朝我林修道處所，當作大會，多有眾生，百千聚集，甚大喧鬧，而大沙門！
translation: In the morning, there will be a great assembly of many sentient beings assembled in my forest to cultivate enlightenment. There will be hundreds of thousands of living beings and it will be very noisy and noiseless, sir.

source_sentence: 愛樂寂靜，恒行清淨空閑之處。
translation: They love and delight in quiescence and are always walking in a pure, secluded place.

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: Sramanaries!

translation: You can move away from this place and seek a quiet place to live elsewhere (as explained here in the Saṃkhya).'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊從彼住處，即便移至差梨迦林，至彼林已，心念彼四迦婁羅王，
translation: At that time the World-honored One departed from his dwelling place and proceeded on his way to the forest of khadiraka. Having arrived there, he thought of these four garuḍa kings:

source_sentence: 王名可觸，又四提頭賴吒龍王，四水神龍，四大天王，帝釋天主，及餘欲界一切諸天，
translation: The king’s name can be touched. Also there are the four guardian nāga kings of Tīralāṭa, the four water spirits, the four great deva kings, Indra and all the other deities in the realm of desire.

source_sentence: 娑婆世界主大梵天等，並皆念之。
translation: The lords of the sahā world, the great Brahmā gods, and so forth are all mindful of it.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等四可觸王，迦婁羅等，知佛內心如是念已，出現大風，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉所居住處，
translation: “At that time, those four touchable kings, such as Kālôdayin and the others, knowing this thought within the Buddha’s mind, produced a gale of wind from the place where Kāśyapa was living in Uruvilvā.

source_sentence: 飛騰虛空，即時往詣差梨迦林。
translation: They flew up into the sky and immediately went to the Kālīyaka Forest.

source_sentence: 到彼處已，頂禮佛足，合十指掌，却住一面，遙覩世尊，向佛頂禮。
translation: Having arrived at that place, he bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, joined his palms ten fingers together, withdrew to one side, looked down at the World-honored One from a distance, and saluted him by bowing his forehead in respect.

source_sentence: 「其四提頭賴吒龍王、四水神王，亦知佛心，出大雲雨，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處，
translation: “These four Dhṛtarāṣṭra nāga kings and the four water spirit kings also knew the Buddha’s mind. They produced great clouds and rain, coming from the place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa lived.

source_sentence: 飛向差梨迦林。
translation: They flew toward the Kālīyaka forest.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，合十指掌，却住一面，向佛遙敬。
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Buddha Bhagavān's feet, joined his palms with ten fingers, withdrew to one side, and venerated him from a distance in front of him.

source_sentence: 是時，四方四大天王，亦知佛心，作大端正可喜之身，為人樂見，顯赫威光，
translation: At that time the four great celestial kings of the four quarters, who were also aware of the Buddha’s mind, magnified themselves into a delightful and dignified form to be seen by everyone.

source_sentence: 照曜自身，悉乘白象，從地湧出，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處，往詣差梨迦林。
translation: Śāriputra himself, riding on a white elephant, emerged from the earth and left the place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa lived to reach the charikā forest.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，乃至合掌，遙敬於佛。
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Buddha Bhagavān's feet, joined his palms, and venerated him from a distance.

source_sentence: 「爾時，忉利帝釋天王，及欲界天娑婆世界主大梵天王，知佛心念，身出威光，
translation: At that time, the lord of the Trāyastriṃśa gods and the great brahma kings of the heavens in the realm of desire as well as the celestial kings of Kālôdayin and Śakra Devānām-Indra and the deva kings of the sahā worlds in the realm of desire perceived the Buddha’s thoughts

source_sentence: 遍照其地，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居住之處，飛騰虛空，一時往詣差梨迦林，
translation: He illuminated the ground everywhere and flew up into the sky from the place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa lived. At once he approached the charikā tree forest.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，乃至曲躬遙敬於佛。
translation: When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Bhagavān's feet and venerated the Buddha from a distance as long as they bent their bodies.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼處一切人民，見如是眾諸天龍等，心生恐怖，身毛皆竪，即便問彼優婁頻螺迦葉等言：『大德和上！
translation: At the time, all the people there saw such a multitude of gods and dragons, and their minds became frightened, and their hair stood on end. They even asked those Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and others, 'O Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此何物神，作斯變怪？
translation: What's this thing that makes such a strange transformation?

source_sentence: 非是災也？
translation: Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is A Disaster?

source_sentence: 或當有疫，或大恐怖，或大鬪諍，或有迦吒富單那鬼，及黑闇鬼，而欲來乎？』
translation: Perhaps there's an epidemic, or a great fear, or a great fight, or a kaṭa-putra ghost, or a black and dark ghost that wants to come?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是念：『此必是彼大德沙門威力，作斯神通變也。』
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'This must be the authoritative power of that great virtuous ascetic who creates this miraculous transformation.'

source_sentence: 即便報彼諸大眾言：『汝等一切！
translation: He then reported to the crowd, saying, 'All of you!

source_sentence: 莫恐莫怖！
translation: Don't be afraid, don't be frightened!

source_sentence: 莫畏莫驚！
translation: Don't be afraid, don't be frightened!

source_sentence: 此非災變，亦非疫病，及以鬪諍、諸鬼魅來，當有無畏，當有豐熟，當無怪異，
translation: This is neither a calamity nor an epidemic, and it will not come from fighting or demons. There will be fearlessness, there will be prosperity, and there will be no strange things.

source_sentence: 不須恐怖，亦無疾病。
translation: They don't need to be frightened, and there's no illness.

source_sentence: 汝等但當安隱自慰，此事無苦，一切諸相，盡皆大吉。』
translation: You must simply comfort yourself in peace, for this matter is not painful, and all its characteristics are completely greatly auspicious.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『我今亦可往詣於彼大沙門邊，度量此事，
translation: At that time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had this thought:

source_sentence: 自應當知，何故何變致使如是？』
translation: You should know for yourself why it's so transformed.'

source_sentence: 彼作如是思惟念已，即便往詣佛世尊所，欲至佛邊，如來忽以神通之力，
translation: Having thought in this way, they immediately went to the place where the World-honored Buddha was. Wishing to approach him, the Tathāgata suddenly came to them through his supernatural powers and said:

source_sentence: 即於其前，化作一箇高峻大山，而彼欲來不能得過，到彼山已，即反迴還。
translation: He then magically created a high, great mountain in front of him, but he couldn't get past it when he wanted to. After reaching that mountain, he turned around and returned.

source_sentence: 過彼夜後還詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, he returned to the Buddha. Having arrived there, he said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 昨日作何如是變怪？
translation: What did you do yesterday that's so strange?

source_sentence: 我從昔來，在此居停，未曾覩見如斯之事。』
translation: Since the distant past, I've lived here and haven't seen anything like this.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即便為彼廣說前事，而彼優婁頻螺迦葉既聞說已，生大希有：『奇特可怪，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One had already explained this extensive discourse for them. Having heard it, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa wondered:

source_sentence: 我多年來在此，恒常祭祀火神，不曾有一旋風之氣至於我邊，況復餘神？
translation: I've been here for many years, always sacrificing myself to the fire deity, and there's never a wind or wind that reaches me, so why wouldn't any other deity?

source_sentence: 然今此處，沙門瞿曇！
translation: Still, in this place, the ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 有大威德，一切諸天，來向其邊。』
translation: With great authority and virtue, all the gods will come to their side.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即於佛邊，生信向心希有之心。
translation: After he had this thought, he immediately gave rise to a rare mind of faith and dedication at the Buddha's side.

source_sentence: 即以心請佛世尊云：『願大沙門！
translation: He then asked the Bhagavān with his mind, 'May great ascetic!'

source_sentence: 明日食時，更於我邊，受我微供，若佛實是一切智者，應知我心。』
translation: When he eats tomorrow, he'll be next to me and accept my humble offerings; if the Buddha really is omniscience, you should know my mind.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，如來即知優婁頻螺迦葉心念，默然而受彼之心請。
translation: After he had this thought, the Tathāgata then knew that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was mindful of it and quietly accepted its invitation.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉還其居處，告諸一切摩那婆言：『汝等詣向大沙門邊，
translation: At that time, the great renunciant Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa returned to his dwelling place and said to all the māṇavas,

source_sentence: 量度觀看，其大沙門，作於何事？
translation: What did that great ascetic do?

source_sentence: 為當求食欲著衣行，為當默然寂靜而坐？』
translation: Why should you seek food and want to put on your robes and walk, or why should you sit quietly in silence?'

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等諸摩那婆，從於優婁頻螺迦葉聞此言已，即便往詣差梨迦林，
translation: At that time, having heard these words from Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the manasattvas and brāhmaṇas went to the cemetery forest.

source_sentence: 到已見佛在彼林內樹下思惟寂然而坐，身出光明，照耀彼處，於食知足，
translation: On arriving there, he saw the Buddha sitting quietly in meditation under a tree in the forest. From his body a ray of light emanating from his body illumined the place and he was content to eat.

source_sentence: 不行乞求，默然而住。
translation: They did not beg for anything and remained silent.

source_sentence: 彼等見已，詣向佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: Seeing this, they went to the Buddha. Having arrived there, they said to him:

source_sentence: 仁今何故不求食也？』
translation: Why wouldn't you ask for food now, sir?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼諸一切摩那婆言：『諸摩那婆！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed all those manas, saying, 'Manas!

source_sentence: 我已被請。』
translation: I've already been invited.'

source_sentence: 彼等問言：『大德沙門！
translation: They asked, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 是誰所請？』
translation: Who asked for it?'

source_sentence: 佛即報言：『汝輩和上，已請我也。』
translation: The Buddha then replied, 'You monks, you've already invited me to do so.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等摩那婆心生於希有：『甚奇可怪！
translation: At the time, those Manabhas had this rare thing in their minds: 'How marvelous and amazing!'

source_sentence: 希有希有！
translation: Rare, rare!

source_sentence: 此大沙門，然口不言，遙知他心。』
translation: This great ascetic doesn't say anything, but he knows the minds of others from a distance.'

source_sentence: 彼等即大歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝。
translation: They then roused with great joy and pervaded their bodies, unable to overcome themselves.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等速疾迴還優婁頻螺迦葉之邊，到已白言：『尊者和上！
translation: At that point, they quickly returned to the side of Uruvilvā-kāśyapa and said, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 我決定知，此大沙門是一切智。
translation: I definitely know that this great ascetic is omniscience.

source_sentence: 和上以心默請於彼，彼即自知和上之心，亦向我語：「我已彼汝和上心請。」』
translation: The monk asked them to be silent with his mind, and they then knew for themselves the monk's mind and said to me, I've already invited you to make a request with your superior mind.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉聞彼語已，即便鋪設大價之座。
translation: After hearing those words, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa even spread out a greatly valued seat.

source_sentence: 鋪設既訖，心發是念：『沙門瞿曇！
translation: Having finished laying the bed, he thought to himself:

source_sentence: 若仁今是一切智者，當應我念即現此座。』
translation: If you're a man of omniscience now, you should think to me and show up here at my seat.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼優婁頻螺迦葉心所念已，身應時現於彼座上。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān knew what that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa thought in his mind, and his body would then appear on that seat.

source_sentence: 「爾時優婁頻螺迦葉，既見世尊在其座上端然而坐，見已歡喜，即以自手，
translation: At that moment, having seen the World-honored One seated on his seat, Upariṭṭṭha Kassapa sat upright. Having seen him, he was delighted.

source_sentence: 將好種種餚饍飲食，持用施佛，所謂噉食唼[口*束]舐啜豐足自恣，
translation: They offered food, drink, and various delicacies to the Buddhas for their enjoyment.

source_sentence: 復作是念：『希有希有！
translation: Again, he thought, 'How rare and rare!'

source_sentence: 此大沙門！
translation: This is a great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great, majestic!

source_sentence: 大有德力！
translation: Great is the power of virtue!

source_sentence: 乃能知我心中所念；
translation: They are able to know what thoughts I have in my mind.

source_sentence: 威神雖然，而猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: Although it's authoritative, it still doesn't attain the fruit of arhatship like I do now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還迴至於差梨迦林，經行而住。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had finished his meal at the side of that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, returned to the charikā forest, and stayed there for a while.

source_sentence: 是時世尊身上所著袈裟之衣悉皆破壞，而彼兵將婆羅門村有於一家人命既終，
translation: At that time, the robes on the Buddha’s upper body and the monastic robes he wore were all destroyed. The soldiers of that army died in a brahman’s village.

source_sentence: 即便林葬，是時，世尊於林見已，即自收取彼糞掃衣，取已世尊作是思念：『我今何處，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was buried in the forest. Seeing him there, the World-honored One collected his clothes made of rags and swept them away on his own. Having collected them, the World-honored One thought:

source_sentence: 洗於如是糞掃之衣，能使清淨？』
translation: Can you wash such a garbage and sweep clothes to make them pure?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋忉利天王既知世尊心意所念，知已即於彼之處所，以手掘地，
translation: At that time, the lord of Trāyastriṃśa gods knew what the World-honored One was thinking in his mind. Knowing this, they went to that place and dug into the ground with their hands.

source_sentence: 造作一池，其水清淨，作已即便諮白佛言：『善哉！
translation: He built a pool of pure water, and after building it, he asked the Buddha, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願以此水洗糞掃衣。』
translation: May I use this water to wash dung and sweep my robes?'

source_sentence: 是時，世尊見池水已，復如是念：『今雖得水，當於何上洗浣是衣？』
translation: Seeing the water in the pond, the Bhagavān then had another thought, 'Now that I've obtained water, where will I wash and wash this robe?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋知佛心已，從鐵圍山將一大石，安置佛前，置以白佛，作如是言：『唯願世尊！
translation: Knowing the Buddha's mind, Indra took a large rock from the iron mountain and placed it in front of him. He placed it in front of the Buddha and said to him:

source_sentence: 於此石上洗蹋是衣。』
translation: On this stone, he washes and stepped on this robe.'

source_sentence: 是時世尊，復如是念：『今雖得石，復當攀何洗蹋此衣？』
translation: The Bhagavān then again thought, 'Now that I've obtained a stone, where will I climb and wash this robe?'

source_sentence: 時彼池岸舊有一樹，名迦拘婆(隋言峯)。
translation: At the time, there was an old tree on the shore of that pond named Kakūṭa (known as Feng in Sui).

source_sentence: 時彼樹間有一樹神，知佛意念，按樹一枝令垂向下，而白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: Knowing the Buddha's thoughts, a tree spirit from among those trees pressed a branch of the tree downward and said to the Buddha, 'Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 攀此樹枝，洗蹋於是糞掃之衣。』
translation: Climb this tree's branch, wash and step on the robes of that dung and sweep it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復如是念：『我洗衣已，復於何上，曝曬此衣？』
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān again thought, 'After I wash my clothes, where else will I expose and dry this robe?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋知佛心念，知已即從鐵圍山間，將一最大寬廣之石，安置佛前。
translation: Knowing the Buddha's thoughts, Indra knew that he had a large and wide stone placed it in front of him from the Iron Mountains.

source_sentence: 既安置已，即白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: After he had placed it there, he said to the Buddha, 'Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於是石上，以用曬衣。』
translation: He then went up on the stone to use it to dry his clothes.'

source_sentence: 是時世尊，即於石上曬糞掃衣。
translation: The Bhagavān then dried his excrement and sweeping robes on the stone.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa went to the Buddha. Having arrived there, he said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 食時已至，辦具訖了。』
translation: When it's time to eat, the preparations are complete.'

source_sentence: 又復白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 已前此處無有是池，今日何故忽有此池？
translation: There hasn't been such a pond here before, so why did this pond suddenly exist today?

source_sentence: 此處已前無是二石，又從何來？
translation: Before this place, there weren't these two stones; where did they come from?

source_sentence: 其迦拘婆此樹已前，枝不垂下今日何緣如是嚲垂？
translation: Before this tree, the Kākauṣa didn't hang down its branches, so why did it not hang down like that today?

source_sentence: 不知何緣忽然如此？』
translation: I don't know what causes it to suddenly be like this?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，默然不言。
translation: After he said this, he remained silent and didn't say anything.

source_sentence: 佛告優婁頻螺迦葉作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: The Buddha addressed Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'Sir, my dear Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 此處我得糞掃之衣，彼時我作如是心念：「以何浣此糞掃之衣？」
translation: Here, I obtained a robe made of dirty sweeping cloth, and at the time, I thought to myself, What did you wash this robe made of dirty sweeping cloth?

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋知我心念，以手掘池出此池水，而白我言：「世尊！
translation: Knowing my thoughts, the emperor then dug out this lake with his hand and drew water from it, and he said to me, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今可以此池水洗糞掃衣。」
translation: Now, you can wash dung and sweep your clothes with water from this pond.

source_sentence: 以如是故，至今相傳，名為帝釋手掘之池。
translation: Because of this, it is called the pond dug by Indra’s hand.

source_sentence: 得是水已，我復更作如是思念：「我於何上，蹋糞掃衣？」
translation: After obtaining this water, I again thought, Where will I step on my robe made of rags and sweeps?

source_sentence: 「『爾時，帝釋知我心念，從鐵圍山，將一大石，來置此地，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: 'At the time, knowing my thoughts, Indra knew that a large rock came from the iron-backed mountain and placed it here, and he said to me, Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於此石上，用洗浣衣。」
translation: On this stone, he uses it to wash his robes.

source_sentence: 是故此名非人擲石。
translation: That's why it's called not a person tossing a stone.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，作如是念：「我手攀何而蹋是衣？」
translation: At the time, I thought, Where did I steal this robe with my hand?

source_sentence: 「『爾時，彼樹迦拘婆神知我心念，以手按此樹枝令垂，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: 'At the time, that tree Kālôdayin knew what I was thinking, pressed a branch of this tree with his hand to make it hang and said to me, Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 手攀此枝，用脚蹋衣。」
translation: He climbs this branch with his hand and uses his feet to step on the robe.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此樹之枝如是懸垂。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, the branches of this tree hang up like this.

source_sentence: 得於枝已，我如是念：「今於何上，曬於此衣？」
translation: After I had obtained the branch, I thought, Where will I dry this robe?

source_sentence: 「『爾時，帝釋知我心念，從鐵圍山，將此廣石，擲置我前，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: 'At the time, knowing my thoughts, Tīrṣa took this large rock from the iron mountain and tossed it in front of me, saying, Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於此石上曬所浣衣。」
translation: On this stone, he dries the clothes he washes on it.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此石名為非人所擲。』
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, this stone is called a rock that's not thrown by someone.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa had this thought, 'This great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Great is the power!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great is the supernormal power!

source_sentence: 乃能令彼天主帝釋而來供承；
translation: He was able to cause Indra, the ruler of the gods, to come and make offerings to them.

source_sentence: 變現雖然，但大沙門，理實未得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: Although it's a manifestation, it's only a great ascetic who hasn't really attained the fruit of arhatship like I have now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，迴還至林，經行而住。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had finished his meal at that place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying, returned to the forest, walked, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa went to the Buddha. Having arrived there, he said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, then your food and drink have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 是時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'Sir, my dear friend!

source_sentence: 汝於前去，我即隨來。』
translation: Go ahead, and I'll follow you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊既發遣彼優婁頻螺迦葉去已，即乘神通向須彌山。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had dismissed that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and departed, so he rode his supernormal powers to Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 是時彼山有閻浮樹，以彼閻浮樹因緣故，所以得此閻浮提名。
translation: At the time, there was a Jambudvīpa tree on that mountain, and because of the causes and conditions for that Jambudvīpa tree, this Jambudvīpa name was obtained.

source_sentence: 於彼樹上，取得菓已，於先來至優婁頻螺迦葉居處火神堂中，端然而坐。
translation: Having obtained the fruit on that tree, he came to Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa's place in the fire deity hall and sat down straight upright.

source_sentence: 而彼優婁頻螺迦葉在後來，見如來坐於火神堂內，見已驚怪，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: When Uruvilvā Kāśyapa was at the back, he saw the Tathāgata sitting inside the fire deity hall. Seeing him, he was startled and said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 仁從何道，而來至此？
translation: Where did you come from?

source_sentence: 仁元在林，於我後發，即今何忽在我前，到此火神堂其中安坐？』
translation: Ren Yuan was in the forest, and after I arose, why did he suddenly come before me and sit quietly in this fire deity's hall?'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我先發遣汝已，至須彌山，彼有一樹，名曰閻浮，因彼樹故，此今得是閻浮提名。
translation: I've sent you up to Mount Sumeru, where there's a tree named Jambudvīpa, and because of that tree, this is the presently named Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 彼樹上菓，我今將來在此堂內。』
translation: That fruit on the tree will now come here in this hall.'

source_sentence: 指示迦葉：『彼閻浮菓即此是也，顏色端正，香味微妙，食者甚美，汝今可取此之甘菓而噉食之。』
translation: He instructed Kāśyapa, 'That Jambudvīpa fruit is the same as this one, with a correct appearance, delicate fragrance, and delicious food that's very good to eat; now, you can take this sweet fruit and eat it.'

source_sentence: 爾時迦葉即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: It was then that Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 此事不然，仁自合噉此之甘菓，我不應食。』
translation: If this isn't the case, then kindness will combine with this sweet fruit and I won't eat it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉心如是念：『此大沙門，大有神通！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa had this thought in his mind, 'This great ascetic has great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Great is the power!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣我已，其身自到須彌山，取閻浮菓，來此火神堂，於前而坐；
translation: Having first sent me away, he went on his own to the polar mountain and took some Jambudvīpa fruits. He came to this fire deity hall and sat down in front of it.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，速還向於林內經行。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had finished his meal at that place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying, and quickly returned to the forest to walk.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，至明清旦，往詣佛所，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Buddha at dawn and said to him:

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, then your food and drink have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告迦葉言：『迦葉汝今且於先行，我隨後去。』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, you must now go ahead; I'll follow you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於先發遣迦葉去已，即復還自向須彌山，離閻浮樹相去不遠更有一樹，
translation: “At that time, the World-honored One had previously dismissed Kāśyapa. Having departed, he returned on his way back to Mount Sumeru. Not far from the Jambudvīpa tree there was another tree:

source_sentence: 名菴婆羅。
translation: It's called Upāli.

source_sentence: 從菴婆羅，取得一菓，於先來到迦葉住處火神堂坐。
translation: From Ambapālī, he obtained a fruit and sat in the fire deity hall where Kāśyapa had previously come to live.

source_sentence: 迦葉後來，見於世尊在火神堂安然而坐，見已白佛，作如是言：『大德沙門！
translation: Later, Kāśyapa saw the Bhagavān sitting peacefully in the fire deity's hall. Seeing him, he said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 在我前到此火神堂。』
translation: I'll go to this fire deity hall in front of me.'

source_sentence: 「佛告迦葉：『我遣汝後，至須彌山，取得於是菴婆羅菓，將來在此，
translation: “The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: Later, I will send you up to Mount Sumeru and obtain some of the ambrosia fruit that is about to come here.

source_sentence: 乃至先勸迦葉令食。』
translation: He even first encouraged Kāśyapa to allow him to eat.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：『我不合食。』
translation: Kāśyapa said, 'I won't eat together.'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉心如是念：『此大沙門，大有神通！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa had this thought in his mind, 'This great ascetic has great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Great is the power!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣於我，到須彌山，取菓將來，於先而坐；
translation: So he was able to send me off beforehand. He came to Mount Sumeru, took the fruit that was about to come, and sat down before him.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，還迴至彼林內經行。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān ended his meal at that place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying and returned back to the forest to walk.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，至明清旦，往詣佛所，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Buddha at dawn and said to him:

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, then your food and drink have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 乃至去彼閻浮提樹處所不遠，有呵梨樹，將彼菓來，先到迦葉火神堂內，
translation: Not far from the place where the Jambudvīpa tree was, there was a chestnut tree that brought some fruit. He came before he entered the hall of Kāśyapa’s fire deity.

source_sentence: 乃至沙門，大有神通，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: Even the śramaṇas have great supernatural powers, and even though they still can't become arhats like I am now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行，乃至去彼閻浮提近，更有一樹，名毘醯勒，
translation: “Then the World-honored One, having subdued the food, returned to that forest and walked up and down. Not far from there, near Jambudvlpa, was another tree called Videla (Abhijit).

source_sentence: 彼樹上取一菓，將來先到堂內。
translation: On top of that tree, he took a fruit and went to the hall before he arrived.

source_sentence: 乃至如前，此大沙門，大有神通，先遣我身，其後取菓，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: As before, this great renunciant with great supernormal powers first sent me away, and then took the fruit, even though he still couldn't become an arhat like I am now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行，乃至去彼閻浮提樹，更有一樹，名阿摩勒，
translation: “Then the World-honored One, having subdued the food, returned to that forest and walked up and down. As far as the foothills of Jambudvīpa’s tree were located, there was another tree, called an amala tree:

source_sentence: 彼樹取菓，於先將來，坐火神堂。
translation: That tree took the fruit and was sitting in the fire deity hall when it came before him.

source_sentence: 乃至沙門，大有神通，先發遣我，身後將菓來火神堂，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: Even the śramaṇas have great supernatural powers. They first sent me away, and after their bodies I brought some fruit to the fire deity’s hall. Although they still did not acquire arhatship like my present [existence], how could they do so?

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had finished his meal and returned to that forest to walk.

source_sentence: 是時，優樓頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所。
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: Having arrived at the Buddha's place, he said to him, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, then your food and drink have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『汝先且去，我隨後來。』
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'First, go away; I'll come after you.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊遣迦葉已，至瞿耶尼，到彼處已，乞乳滿鉢，在前來至火神堂內。
translation: At that time the World-honored One, having dismissed Kāśyapa, arrived at Gotama. Having arrived there, he begged for milk to fill his bowl and came before [the Buddha] into the hall of the fire deity.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉，見已白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Upon seeing him, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 在於我前，到此堂內。』
translation: You're here in front of me, and you'll go inside this hall.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『我遣汝後，到瞿耶尼，乞得是乳，滿此鉢中，在是而坐。
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'After sending you away, I'll go to Goyanī and beg for this milk, fill it in this bowl, and sit here.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 是乳顏色微妙，香氣甘美，汝意若樂，取此乳飲。』
translation: The color of this milk is subtle and its fragrance sweet, so if you like it, take this milk and drink it.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『我不堪飲，沙門自飲。』
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'I can't drink it; the ascetic drinks it himself.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa had this thought, 'This great ascetic is so powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great is the supernormal power!

source_sentence: 乃先遣我，其後身往瞿耶尼國，乞乳滿鉢，先來至此火神堂內；
translation: He sent me first, and after that I went to the country of Goyanī to beg for milk to fill my bowl with milk.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第四十一
translation: Fobenxing ji jing, vol. 41
